Name: Box with Wig Support
Description: Made for the king's headdress, this plain rectangular wooden case with hinged lid contained a block-headed wig support. Its panels are decorated with simple blue and yellow faience and semitranslucent calcite ornaments. The remnants of the king's cap were found in the bottom of the box. Unfortunately, the cloth had decayed, but the remnants enabled us to record the order of the beads and the form of the skullcap.
